name: Website Re-platform & Rebuild
description: I was part of the Digital transformation team working with both internal and external stakeholders on a 6-month website re-design project onto the Wordpress platform. An exciting role with a good mix of technical project management and hands-on development and in ensuring the Website was built upto high standards and within time

name: Mobile Apps, Web Portals
description: I started working full-time for my company from mid 2017 where my main responsibilities were building the front-end for our mobile apps and website portals, along with my technical co-founder. Most of my time was spent on building the front-end of our hybrid mobile apps with the Ionic framework using best practices in ES6 and Typescript. Other tasks were building our website in Gatsby.js - a React based static site generator and simple UI components for our internal fund administration portal in React

name: APTouring and Travel Marvel
description: Most of time at IE was spent within the Sitecore teams where I was a part of an 18-month responsive build of both the APTouring and Travel Marvel websites. The projects were interesting in terms of scalability and re-use of components for both these websites. I was part of a large cross-functional team of 10+ including PMs, Back-end and Front-end devs, Business Analysts, UX/Graphic Designers, Scrum Masters, Testers and on-site clients, incorporating the best practices in Agile project delivery

name: Movember Responsive Build
description: One of my first roles as a commercial front-end dev in a large project was very rewarding in terms of skills-development and learning through the best practices in front-end development. Being a non-profit client, it had a good social responsibility motive as well. I was part of a large cross-functional team of 10+ including PMs, Back-end and Front-end devs, Business Analysts, UX/Graphic Designers, Scrum Masters, Testers and on-site clients, incorporating the best practices in Agile project delivery
